meanings.definition: Simple past tense and past participle of 'yell'.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she yelt for help when she saw the spider.
meanings.sent2: He yelt loudly to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The baby yelt in excitement when she saw the colorful toy.
meanings.sent4: The thunder yelt across the sky, announcing the storm's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The coach yelt instructions to the players during the game.

meanings.definition: A loud, sharp cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The yelt of the baby echoed through the house.
meanings.sent2: His yelt could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The yelt of the seagulls filled the air at the beach.
meanings.sent4: Her yelt of joy when she won the race was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The yelt of the referee signaled the end of the match.
